title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2810.1 - Purpose
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2810.1 - Purpose

State Regulations
(a) Chapter 347 of
the Laws of 1980, as amended, added a new article XVII to the Private Housing

Finance Law, commonly known as the Rural Preservation Companies Program. The
purpose of this act is to encourage and support the efforts of not-for-profit
community-based organizations engaged in rural preservation by providing
funding for administrative and planning costs essential for ongoing
implementation of housing preservation and community renewal activities
designed to meet the unmet housing needs of persons and families of low and
moderate income and to foster the most effective use of public and private
resources for these purposes. (b) The rules and regulations contained herein are applicable to making funds
available to rural preservation companies for rural preservation activities
pursuant to the provisions of article XVII of the Private Housing Finance Law, as amended. (c) Not-for-profit
organizations participating in the program are eligible for contracts limited
in duration for no more than a one-year term, with the possibility of renewing, extending or entering into new contracts. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2810.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
